summary: This document is an email chain from August 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing the handling of Touhy requests from victims of Jeffrey Epstein involved in civil litigation. The emails detail the process for responding to requests for documents, coordination with the Maxwell prosecution team, and legal considerations regarding the production of investigative materials from different districts.

persons.name: Roberta Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney representing an Epstein victim in civil litigation; the recipient of a Touhy process letter from the SDNY.

persons.name: Robbie Kaplan
persons.context: Referenced as counsel for a plaintiff/victim; point of contact for the SDNY regarding Touhy requests.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Referred to as the 'responsible' U.S. Attorney who might receive a Touhy referral from another district.

connections.description: Both are attorneys (likely at the same firm, Kaplan Hecker) representing Epstein victims in civil litigation.

events.title: Final Approval for Touhy Response Letter
events.description: SDNY staff finalize and approve a letter responding to a Touhy request from an Epstein victim, with qualifiers added in track changes.

events.title: Maxwell Team Approval of Touhy Response
events.description: An updated letter responding to a Touhy request from an Epstein victim is circulated, with the Maxwell prosecution team having signed off on the version.

events.title: Production of Documents to Epstein Victim
events.description: SDNY prepares to send a letter and produce documents in response to a Touhy request from a victim who is a plaintiff in a civil suit against Epstein's estate.

events.title: Establishment of Touhy Request Process
events.description: SDNY designates a point person to handle Touhy requests from civil plaintiffs/victims in Epstein lawsuits and plans to send an initial letter outlining the request process to plaintiff's counsel.

keyFacts: The SDNY was handling formal Touhy requests from Epstein victims involved in civil litigation for government documents.
The Maxwell prosecution team was consulted and approved responses to these Touhy requests.
The SDNY possessed FBI investigative files from the SDFL Epstein investigation but deliberately avoided obtaining files from the SDFL U.S. Attorney's Office due to conflict and discovery issues.
There was internal discussion about the procedural complexity of referring requesters to other U.S. Attorney's Offices (SDFL or NDGA) for materials not in SDNY's possession.
Communications regarding Touhy requests were noted as potentially disclosable as Giglio information.
